resources.string: Store personal notes, contact info or questions for the speakers
Your notes will be displayed here, after you save them with a click on save. Keep in mind, this storage is not very persistent!
To support us, ping one of the organizers on our slack

As community of volunteers we work with external speakers and tutors.\nOur meetups are possible not only thanks to us but also thanks to the wonderful support, that we receive from Google and companies that are listed below. This is our contribution to making Berlin\'s tech scene diverse and inclusive!
We are open to collaborations! Contact Roxy-WTM-organizer via Slack

This App was created as learning project that would benefit the community WTM Berlin 💻. 
It is a great place to start an adventure of becoming an open source contributor! Check the issues list in our GitHub Repository, some are labeled with `good first issue`. Support us by adding a pull request 🚀 
 
👨‍💻 👩‍💻 
 
Feel free to submit issues, pull requests or to create forks:
Organizers and community members about WTMB
WTM Berlin is part of the global \nWomen Techmakers program \nrun by Google

At WTM Berlin we are encouraging diversity in tech in Berlin since 2015. We offer visibility, networking and resources to help you make the tech community of Berlin more diverse and inclusive! Our activities include intense coding study groups, workshops on technical topics and social skills, as well as inspirational fireside chats. New and existing members are always welcome at all events, and all events are always open to everyone, regardless of gender/age/race/experience, etc. We follow the Berlin code of conduct for communities: http://berlincodeofconduct.org
No upcoming events at the moment. Stay tuned!
We are active across social media!
You can find all our events on Meetup.

Slack is one of the main points of our Community - it is a good place to connect with other members, offer positions in #jobs that reach more diverse audience or announce free/discounted diversity tickets.

We are all unpaid volunteers supporting a tech community. Please respect our time! RVSP responsibly and if you can\'t make it to the event - just update your choice on Meetup (no need of sending us a private message). \nThis helps us estimate size of the events for the company, catering service and the attendees.
If you have a skill to offer, like supporting one of our Study Groups on Android, Go, JavaScript or to give a one-time workshop on the topic of your expertise, reach out via slack

The icon below is a very simple toy. If you open the list of apps on your phone and switch the TalkBack, the default accessibility tool for Android apps on, you can explore its hidden functionality. \nTalkBack usage: tap twice to confirm and scroll sideways to navigate. Thanks to this exercise you can understand for your own this everyday experience for some people.

TalkBack should be preinstalled, if not it is available in app store for free. Explore the app in the TalkBack mode and click on the image above will result with an additional functionality. We should be aware of needs of people with impairments, so I highly encourage you to try TalkBack out and to support accessibility features in your project. Adding basic accessibility to an Android app is very easy (for example for web development it is a bit more tricky but still quite straightforward), so after reading an article or watching some videos you can contribute to open source projects, hopefully with more meaningful descriptions than implemented on this one!

Start with adding meaningful labels for custom designed elements (back arrow, check-marks, x) and set importantForAccessibility=no for design elements will not be useful for the user in the screen reader user mode. Provide content descriptions for pictures and elements (ideally descriptions that are more meaningful that the one implemented on the image above). Ah, and mind the text-background contrast. \nYou are good to go! For more resources visit:
If you had any questions, accessibility remarks, or other feedback, submit an issue or reach out via Slack to one of our organizer with WTM icon symbol next to the name
Thanks to the organizers team, all supporters and community members, especially to https://twitter.com/m_jedyny who wrote base base of this app
